job_title: Field Manager in Center Valley, PA
pros: Fun job that requires low hours

pros: The Culture of the University is amazing. The staff and faculty are incredibly approachable.
cons: Leadership is not the best, hard to move up the ladder.

review_title: Great place to work but not very diverse and will burn out
job_title: Associate Professor in Center Valley, PA

burn out is frequent because everyone is expected to take on a little more every few weeks which really adds up
not diverse in general environment nor in leadership

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Center Valley, PA
pros: retirement match, nice campus environment

job_title: Associate Professor in Center Valley, PA
pros:
Love fellow faculty and academic programming. Significant teaching workload. 
Students are amazing!
cons: salaries are not as competitive as many would like; no built in increases for promotion to different levels.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Center Valley, PA
pros:
Faculty help student prosper in their field.
Great environment for learning.
Decent pay for student research jobs in the summer.

job_title: Library Technical Services Specialist in Center Valley, PA
pros: It was a great environment to work in and a great opportunity to help the DSU community as well as other LVAIC-affiliated universities looking for inter-library loans.
cons: Not many hours available to work as other work study positions.

job_title: Police Officer in Lehigh Valley, PA
pros: Support, Benefits, Close knit community, Small school, Staff, Students
cons: It is still a university, deal with normal college things, kids, politics, etc

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Center Valley, PA
pros: Good good good good good

job_title: Admissions Officer in Center Valley, PA
pros: Decent benefits, retirement contribution / match
cons: Very socially conservative, even to a practicing Catholic; most employees are alumni so there is little diversity of experience and background

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Warminster, PA
pros:
- flexible hours
- good for work study jobs
- writing tutor has nice pay and keeps people busy
- you might not have a lot of work to do so you can get homework and projects done
cons: - can get bored easily depending on position

job_title: Information Technology in Center Valley, PA
pros: Friendly people and good holiday schedule. Just started half day fridays during the summer.
cons: IT support is contracted out to Computer Aid. It does not appear that Computer Aid or DeSales cares about its team of IT professionals. To reinforce this they stick the whole team in the basement without windows. Growth in any IT position here is very limited if there is any at all -- very small team. Over worked and low pay. High turn over creates additional work load in user setup and break down. Their IT infrastructure is out dated and plagued with problems. Chain of command prevents your ability to stand out in anything you do here.  Also, not that I'm opposed to hearing other views, its just overwhelming the liberal opinions heard here -- probably consistent with all higher academia though.

review_title: Full Time, Tenured, Associate Professor, Chair of a Department
job_title: Associate Professor, Chair of A Department in Center Valley, PA
pros: This was a great fit for me. I identify with the mission of the organization, I love the people I work with and feel supported by the upper administration.
cons: They have had a difficult time with their website, and communicating to the world what a great place they are.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Center Valley, PA
pros: I have worked at five major universities and two community colleges.  DeSales by far is the Greatest!  They respect their adjunct professors, and treat us like Gold.
cons: I don't get a chance to work every term.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Center Valley, PA
pros: Students are friendly and kind, respectful. Expectations are clear and colleagues are happy to work with you as you get settled into your role.
cons: Lack of tenure-track positions makes it a hard-sell for those wanting TT. However, there are renewable contracts.

job_title: Resident Advisor in Quakertown, PA
pros: It was great being there. Once you get the job essentially you are your own boss. You dictate your own workload and work at your own pace.
cons: The only problem with ResLife is the leadership that they have. They say they have your back, but if push comes to shove you are more on your own

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Center Valley, PA
pros: The environment and people, employees and students, at DSU are very nice.  As an adjunct instructor I have access to all of the school's resources and training.    Pay is fair.
cons: I have not been able to increase the number of courses I teach.  I think this is because of competition for adjunct positions.  Like many organizations, it's difficult to get a full-time position.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Harleysville, PA
pros: Outstanding organization.  The best university at which I have ever taught.
cons: Cannot get as many semesters as i want to get.

review_title: As a work-study student, it was a positive experience
job_title: Tutor in Center Valley, PA
pros: Flexible hours, caring supervisors, hard-working colleagues and responsible students made working there worthwhile, challenging and fun.
cons: At times, it seemed as though I couldn't get enough hours.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Center Valley, PA
pros: Students are serious about what they are undertaking.  Faculty have input into texts used etc.  Very comfortable place to work.
cons: Adjuncts limited to four classes a year.

job_title: Work Study Student in Center Valley, PA
pros: I learned a lot and it was a great way to make money on campus.

job_title: in Center Valley, PA
